Kāsika，（adj．） [cp．Sk．kāśika & in a diff．sense aḍḍha-kāsika] belonging to the Kāsī country，or to Benares； in °uttama （scil．vattha） an upper garment made of Benares cloth Pv．I，10<sup>8</sup>； J．VI，49 （where to be read kāsik’uttama for kāsi-kuttama）．°vattha Benares muslin A．I，248； III，50； Pug．34； Miln．2； DhA．I，417； Vism．115．（Page 212）
V
Kāsika：The name of a tribe； probably the inhabitants of Kāsi．  Ap．ii．359．
V

Kāsika：A city．Sixty-five kappas ago the Thera Bodhighariya lived   there as cakkavatti．The city was built by Vissakamma and was ten leagues in   length and eight in width．It was built entirely of precious metals．The   king&#39；s palace was called Mangala．Ap．ii．401．

kāsika：ကာသိက （ပု）
